Articles.Content: In the KSP current release, stock no mods, is there a way to show the altitude on the staging screen as actual meters above cumulus granite, as opposed to meters above sea level?
there is one in most cockpit views, it's analogue though.

In the KSP current release, stock no mods, is there a way to show the altitude on the staging screen as actual meters above cumulus granite, as opposed to meters above sea level?

Most pods have a radar altimeter inside if you use IVA view, but if you want to read it from external views I don't think there is a way to display it without using mods.
It's one I've never understood either...why every other gauge is accessible from the staging screen but you have to go IVA to get to a radar altimeter...

Especially since landings without parachutes are pretty much only do-able in the Staging screen.

It's quite nerve-wracking to watch those numbers count down and not know which number is the one that hurts. :-)

It's quite nerve-wracking to watch those numbers count down and not know which number is the one that hurts. :-)

Why is it only do-able from staging? Powered landings are the one thing I use IVA mode for, as all the important items (navball, vertical speed, ground range) are there.

I guess because the view from the cockpit for most of my lander designs means that my windows are pointing to the sky. I like to see the ground I'm heading for, and change my approach if I see that I'm heading for a steep slope.
